detected_issues.title: Accessibility Permissions Not Granted
detected_issues.description: AURA does not have accessibility permissions required for fast path execution This prevents AURA from accessing application UI elements directly, forcing all commands to use the slower vision-based fallback method.
detected_issues.impact: All commands will fall back to slower vision-based processing | Fast path execution completely disabled | All commands use slower vision processing (5-10x slower) | Increased system resource usage | Higher failure rate for complex UI interactions
remediation_steps: Restart the application after granting accessibility permissions
Ensure the application has full disk access if running on macOS 10.15+
Verify that the application can access other applications' UI elements
Some accessibility features may not work reliably
Consider granting full accessibility permissions for optimal performance
Grant accessibility permissions immediately to restore fast path functionality
Open System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy > Accessibility
Add Terminal (or your Python IDE) to the accessibility permissions list
Restart AURA after granting permissions to activate fast path
Verify the fix by running AURA diagnostics again
Test with a simple command to confirm functionality

recommendations: 🚨 CRITICAL ISSUES DETECTED - Address immediately:
• Accessibility Permissions Not Granted: Restart the application after granting accessibility permissions
🔐 ACCESSIBILITY PERMISSIONS REQUIRED:
1. Open System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy > Accessibility
2. Click the lock icon and enter your password
3. Add Terminal (or your Python IDE) to the list
4. Restart AURA to activate fast path functionality
⚡ PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION:
• 1 applications have poor element detection
• Consider updating applications to latest versions
• Check application-specific accessibility settings
🛡️ PREVENTIVE MEASURES:
• Run diagnostics weekly to catch issues early
• Keep applications updated for better accessibility support
• Monitor system resources to prevent performance degradation
